sub_title: Corporate Executive, Company Chairman/CEO, Board Member, Founding Environmentalist, Entrepreneur, Investor, Statesman, Explorer, World Traveler, Political Economist, College Lecturer, Writer, Journalist.
summary:
“Swiss/Canadian Entrepreneur, Investor, Director, Financier who has had a lifetime of entrepreneurial projects running major multi-national corporations and initial start-up enterprises. The latest development included helping to build the first large-scale (103-600 hectares) vertically integrated, owned and operated plantation with Triniterio/Criollo/Hybrid cacao beans and fine chocolate processing factory in the Tropics. The plantation is in protected rain forest-covered land, the chocolate processing factory uses modern craft production equipment, and the supply chain uses logistics, marketing, distribution and sales worldwide without intermediary middlemen/women or contractors.  

Every piece of this enterprise from the trees on the plantation to the final bars/bricks of 100% pure, fine craft chocolate are owned, managed and operated by a small team of investor managers.  

This reverses centuries of history when only beans were exported to Europe and America. Workers on the plantation are not small landholders growing a few beans and living subsistence lives. They are highly trained, employed and well-paid employees of a major industrial operation which produces a formula of Fine Chocolate following 4,000 -10,000 years of Central American knowledge, experience and source of the finest cacao beans in the world. 

There are no impoverished workers, no child slave labour and no need to affix marketing labels on packages of product which no longer contain the required amount of pure cacao from the original beans. 

Today's so-called 'chocolate' sold in supermarkets and food outlets worldwide (in major chains and chocolateries falsely labelling the product as +70% cacao on one side, lists an entirely different list of ingredients under law on the back side in small print. Accurate contents allow consumers to realize most chocolate contains little or no cacao.

Check out  http://www.interopag.com

projects.title: Fiber Optic Internet Connections for the BEL commnuities in Noord Holland
projects.description: Designing, building and implementing a Fiber Optic Ring around the communities of Blaricum, Eemnes and Laren, (BEL Geemente) in Noord Holland, the Netherlands. Supplying a fiber optic cable to improve internet access, data transfer, VoIP telephony and Television transmission into 25,000 people's homes, offices and businesses for one of the least-connected but highly-prized communities and living spaces in the Netherlands.

contributors.headline: Corporate Executive, Company Chairman/CEO, Board Member, Founding Environmentalist, Entrepreneur, Investor, Statesman, Explorer, World Traveler, Political Economist, College Lecturer, Writer, Journalist.

projects.title: Heaven's Gate Resort
projects.description:
NORTH AMERICA'S FIRST PEDESTRIAN MOUNTAIN COMMUNITY: Fernie, British Colombia Canada
    
Heaven’s Gate will pioneer the first completely new major four season mountain destination created in North America almost 30 years.  The pedestrian mountain community will be located on 743 acres of bench lands, nestled 500 feet directly above the City of Fernie, B.C.  

Pedestrian communities have been proven to increase intergenerational social interaction and facilitate a much healthier overall lifestyle while dramatically reducing air and noise pollution.  

The ground-breaking pedestrian community will include world class conference facilities, HOTEL accommodation, single and multi-family housing, and a sustainable working farm.

Heaven’s Gate will emphasize ecotourism and showcase leading environmental technologies and sustainable community development.

contributors.headline: Corporate Executive, Company Chairman/CEO, Board Member, Founding Environmentalist, Entrepreneur, Investor, Statesman, Explorer, World Traveler, Political Economist, College Lecturer, Writer, Journalist.

projects.title: Creating a Global Capital for the World's Oceans to co-ordinate research, restoration, protection and preservation of all who live on, around, in or under all the world's water:  rivers, lakes, bays, gulfs, seas and oceans in Monte Carlo, Monaco.
projects.description:
This proposal brings greater global awareness, protection and programs to enhance the largest nation on Earth, the unclaimed “Seas and Oceans” and all they contain. Since Prince Albert I of Monaco in the 19th Century with his worldwide explorations and built the Oceanographic Institute, the research of Jacques Cousteau to the present global efforts of Prince Albert II, Monaco is a natural choice to be the global capital of the ongoing scientific research, protection and programs to restore the world’s open ocean waters. 

With unparalleled resources including a Museum, the research Institute, an exploration ship and global programs, the combined efforts emanating from Monaco for over a Century and a half allow it to assume world leadership in promoting attention, continued exploration, scientific research and specific works projects towards improving the health of saltwater seas and interconnected fresh waters around the globe.

contributors.headline: Corporate Executive, Company Chairman/CEO, Board Member, Founding Environmentalist, Entrepreneur, Investor, Statesman, Explorer, World Traveler, Political Economist, College Lecturer, Writer, Journalist.

projects.title: Saanenland Master Plan, Gstaad Switzerland
projects.description:
Famous for attracting the film stars and bon vivants of the past, it is now filling with the future new entrepreneurs from around the globe. Many want to improve life for their children and those who farmed here for centuries. 

To retain a quiet, recreational, village space yet grow with global acclaim and future appreciation needs some very careful planning. 

Several hidden backbones into the mix of housing, sports and hospitality are needed creating the world’s most respected, integrated and sustainable villages centred from Gstaad/Saanen and extending in every direction. 

The most critical projects include a regional hospital, commuter airport, power, railway and road networks to satisfy future passenger loads. These will bring more global visitors to keep the hospitality and sporting industries full year round. Add to this a permanent concert hall doubling as a conference centre hosting a dozen global summits in the off-seasons. These can range from the most advanced entrepreneurs, investors, medical science, education, sports facilities and the hospitality industry. This will fill the concert hall more than for just summer Menuhin and Country Festivals. The conferences pay for the entire infrastructural process. These will add significant advantage to the good, existing schools.

Runway lights and radar to the airport will bring commuters in small, silent STOL and HAV aircraft from around the world via Geneva and Zurich. Permanent market stalls at the railway stations for the local farmers and artisans can sell their products to foreign visitors.

A 20 year cash flow statement proves it will produce the most sustainable and advanced villages in the world. It lays the groundwork for the rest of the world to visit, holiday and some will copy us for another century.

contributors.headline: Corporate Executive, Company Chairman/CEO, Board Member, Founding Environmentalist, Entrepreneur, Investor, Statesman, Explorer, World Traveler, Political Economist, College Lecturer, Writer, Journalist.

profile_positions.description: 2022/23: The Executive Producer of a Documentary Film to be shot in 12 countries which explores, explains and defines the History of Food Production around the world. The Focal point of the12 part, hour long, monthly series is presenting food to the world’s children. This will provide valuable insight into nutrition, healthcare and the avoidance of serious diseases later on in life. A world-class, award-winning Swiss film team will shoot, edit and complete the filming, presented by long-time Monaco resident Machteld Schrama (Dutch national), with songs and original music by popstar Annet Hesterman (finalist in the Netherlands Senior Voice of Holland) and her accompanist Cees Cools. Filming will focus on the main sources of the seven food group products explaining the science behind  nutritional values that sustain a very healthy lifestyle throughout one’s entire life, avoiding the multiple diseases of obesity, diabetes, cardiac and cancer deaths. The film will be syndicated for television audiences in 125 countries.
profile_positions.title: Founder -Executive Producer

profile_positions.description:
1976-2019: PGA Professional Golfer, course designer, upgrading, construction, instructor, builder, owner, operator, International Tournament Sponsor and Manager. 
2017: Designing 16th Hole Stadium for the KLM Dutch Golf Tournament at “The Dutch” Club in Spijk, Brabant, Netherlands, September 2017. Assisted by Dwayne Updike, from joint contributory efforts managing security, seating, parking, WC’s, catering, transport shuttles, electricity, water, TV sales, hotels, sponsors, advertising, bar, opening hours, entertainment, organization and student/volunteer participation with the European Tour, the Dutch Club and sponsors. The initiative follows on contributions to managing the Phoenix FBR and Waste Management Golf Tournaments, 2005-2016) at the TPC West Golf Course in Scottsdale, Arizona. The 25,000 seat capacity stadium around the 16th hole contributed to the +700,000 spectators who attend the biggest golf tournament in the world known as “The Greatest Show on Grass”. 

2015 Working with Champion PGA Professional Soren Hansen to develop major new golf courses. Courses included are Heaven's Gate Resort and Permanent Village, Fernie, British Columbia, Canada and the Monte-Carlo Golf Course in Monaco. 

2010-2011  VALE S.A.:Consultant to the CEO for the construction of the world's largest iron ore mine in the Republic of Guinea – Conakry. The project will cost +$8 billion and include the construction of a 960 km Trans-Guinean Railway, three open cast iron ore mines Simandou I and II.

1980-98 BECHTEL CIVIL AND MINERALS INC. Consultant to Chairman. Wrote Master Plans for the Reconstruction of the entire DR Congo, the development of mineral and water resources for the Government of Botswana, the development of an integrated infrastructure plan for mining, power, road and rail development throughout East Africa (Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda). 

1995  HOLDERBANK/HOLCIM A.G. Consultant to Chairman, Purchased the Tanga Cement Company from the Government of Tanzania.
profile_positions.title: Chairman and CEO

profile_positions.location: London UK; New York City USA; Zurich/Geneva Switzerland; Laren, The Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
For many years, engaged as a Chairman/CEO of world-class Corporations, Interop focused on scoping out, initiating and implementing innovative technologies, building major infrastructure projects in mining, petroleum, infrastructure, telecoms, resorts, and financing start-up enterprises. 

These transformed many different businesses in the global economy including remote mining in Emerging Markets; Offshore gas projects providing national electric power grids; Directional drilling in gas fields; VoIP long distance low-cost telephone networks; Exposing, financing and curing communicable pandemic diseases; cross-border cash transfers over cell phones enabling entrepreneurs to bank and invest their earnings securely; First five star resorts integrating spas, golf courses, conferences.   

A new aviation technology will open up remote natural resource projects including the giant Simandou Iron Ore Projects in Guinea, West Africa (Rio Tinto), mineral and petroleum projects in Arctic Canada, the Andes, Australia, Asia, Middle East and other parts of Africa. 

Hybrid airships carrying 20-500 tons of cargo don't need massive construction of infrastructure (including airports, conventional expensive fixed-wing and helicopter aircraft, ports, ships, railways, trains, roads, trucks)  to access these remote projects to build mining, petroleum and agro-industrial projects worldwide. 

These opportunities for dramatic development will save billions of dollars in costs. Airships will transform the world of air cargo, logistics, delivery of new infrastructure and the construction of lower cost extraction projects (minerals, petroleum, food, energy) in remote locations worldwide. 

Permanent, year-round, outdoor-lifestyle, resort villages are planned in Ferney, Blue River, Valemount BC, and Maligne Lake, Alberta, Canada will bring entrepreneurial communities together to identify, finance and implement new technologies, build sustainable infrastructure and mentor new generations.
profile_positions.title: Chairman and CEO

profile_positions.description:
As Chairman CEO of Interop A.G., we have completed a Master Plan for developing the Mt. Robson, Fraser River and Upper Thompson River Valleys in NE British Columbia, Canada. This supports a number of major private investments in mining and four season resorts, as well as public investments in infrastructure to support the developments.

Between Vancouver British Columbia and Edmonton Alberta, the Mount Robson, Fraser and North Thompson River Valleys host the tallest mountain in the Rockies (Mount Robson, 12,972 feet or 3,954 metres) and thousands more like it. The area includes several world-class destinations: Mount Robson and Terry Fox Provincial Parks; Jasper, Lake Louise and Banff National Parks; the towns of Valemount and Blue River, BC, Jasper AB. Hundreds of peaks host annually 10 metres of the world’s finest natural powder snow in the Monashee, Premier, Rocky and Cariboo Mountain Ranges, twice the size of the Alps. 

The area has millions of acres of valleys, lakes, rivers and trail areas for dozens of sports and outdoor activities. These include all skiing - alpine, mountain, cross country, and telemark; biking - mountain, cross country, road, and racing; winter sledding (snow-mobiling), summer all-terrain vehicles, golf, athletics, swimming, fishing, hunting, birding, gliding, parachuting, ballooning, hang gliding, power-kiting, sailing, boating, windsurfing, mountain climbing, trekking, back-packing, camping and dozens of other activities. 

Several new projects are envisaged at Maligne Lake in Jasper NP, Valemount and Blue River BC. These include: a.) The world's largest ski venue; b.) Glacier Mountain Skiing; c.) Condominiums, chalets and hotel complex; d.) Sledding HQ; e.) Mineral Hot Springs Health Spa; f.) Sight-seeing gondola's & ski lifts; f.) Construction of new Tungsten mines; g.) Construction of a Tantalum and Rare Earth Mineral mines; and h.) Cell apps to process international cash transfers at minimal cost, delay or complication.
profile_positions.title: Chairman and CEO

profile_positions.location: Zurich Switzerland, Ottawa Canada, Harare and Victoria Falls Zimbabwe
profile_positions.description: Design, Master Plan, construction of a five star Hotel overlooking one of the Seven Wonders of the World: Victoria Falls. The resort complex has a Gary Player Championship Golf Course, tennis and squash courts, Conference Halls, Restaurants, Game Park, and airport alongside the Zambezi River: Elephant Hills Hotel and Golf Course. The venue was hosted by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, Kings, Queens and 67 Presidents, Prime Ministers of the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting, 2001.
profile_positions.title: Chairman and CEO

profile_positions.description:
A revolution is underway in the global trade and production of quality cacao beans into nutritious, fine craft chocolate. For centuries, the raw material producers of cacao in the tropics did not process the finest chocolate-making machinery like the rest of the world. 

From January 2019, a strategic alliance between two Costa Rican professionals (a plantation agronomist - Moises Gomez) and his wife (Catalina Valeria - a processing engineer) with a Canadian multinational business executive (Robert Stewart) and Monacan investor (Machteld Schrama) join forces to create the world’s first vertically integrated plantation-to-fine-chocolate processing company operating in Costa Rica. 
 
Breaking this North-South global market divide by integrating a 4,000-year-old source of traditional cacao beans with the finest chocolate production marks a dramatic departure in the world of cacao/cocoa/chocolate. 

Industrial chocolate today consisting mainly of soya, industrial white sugar beet, vanilla, chemical flavours and poor quality non-Latin American cacao beans (Forestero beans from Africa, Asia) manufactured under modern industrial processes in the Northern Hemisphere. It has been sold to a global mass market without much nutritional value contributing to numerous modern diseases (cardiovascular, diabetes and obesity). This will be challenged the production of rich Criollo/Triniterio/Hybrid beans filled with healthy, nutritious, locally-processed chocolate from its own exceptional plantation cacao beans in Costa Rica. These Cacao beans are from from the genus of original trees where cacao has been grown for millennium. The nutritional ingredients have a full medicinal value of multiple vitamins, minerals, anti-oxidants and flavenols. 

This craft product promotes a healthy ‘Super Food’. We call it “La Pura Vida”, Costa Rica’s contribution to a true, honest, and healthy food product coming from the finest original beans, with no man-made additives or extractions.
profile_positions.title: Investor

profile_positions.description:
A for-profit privately-funded corporation (not a charity, talk fest, or purely scientific research institute) dedicated to: 1.) Science-based ocean clean-up of all toxins including chemical spills, plastic and garbage; 2.) Replenishment of decimated fish stocks;  and 3.) Preservation of the ocean inhabitants including fish, mammals, aviary and water quality.  

The focus is not on science that leads to no solutions, but clean-up, protection and replenishment based on improving the water quality for feeding oxygen, fish and high quality, non-polluting transport back into the oceans. Since Prince Albert I of Monaco in the 1850's, who brought the discipline of Oceanography into prominence and practise, and Jacques Cousteau who continued developing our understanding of 71% of the Earth's surface, nothing much has happened except dessimation of fish stocks, pollution of the water, destruction of the coral and plankton, entertaining documentary films, lots of conferences, a bottom-less pit of science and research with little improvements, while few have cleaned-up the mess on a global scale to address the challenges facing the seas. 

The World Ocean Corporation (WOC) is not a government ministry filled with civil servants or a charity raising money from crowd funding, publicity, attending conferences, talk-fests or endless research for donations to produce piles of paper or documentary films. 

The WOC is searching for verifiable, engineered results from work programs that translate all the world's information from the past 150 years into the globe's biggest data bank of oceanographic facts producing clearly-defined action projects to restore the ocean's balance with humanity.
profile_positions.title: Founding Chairman

profile_positions.title: Chairman and CEO

profile_positions.description:
2016: Master Plan for the Negotiation of all Outstanding Treaty and Land Claims between the First Nations of British Columbia, the British Columbia Provincial Government, the Federal Government of Canada and all Investor and Stakeholder Interests. Today there are no legal agreements, land claims or treaties between the original Aboriginal First Nations people and Europeans who occupied Canada and settled it. They came as latter-day new owners who permanently stayed without much regard for the original settlers, owners and occupiers of the land. While Treaties and Title Agreements were promised in other Canadian Provinces since each joined Confederation in 1867, few were signed in British Columbia rendering the Province effectively no-man’s-land in legal terms. 

This is a lamentable cultural, legal and political disconnect between all these First Nations people (+119 communities across the Province) and the Non-First Nations peoples who have lived in British Columbia since the early 1800’s. There have been hundreds of bitter disputes over these Land and Treaty Claims offered by the Canadian Government since 1867, but none resolved in the Province of British Columbia. Ultimate title ownership, occupation, stewardship, management, control and responsibility for overseeing the inherent present day or past value of the land for any socio-economic, industrial, agricultural and political use by anyone will be finally determined, negotiated, and singed into contractual legal agreements between all the parties. 

The first initiative in 150 years to resolve these Land and Treaty Claims with the First Nations of British Columbia will be undertaken between July and December, 2016 with the hope that all 119 treaties will be signed giving these people their long-awaited Treaty and Land Rights in legal documentation giving them sovereignty over the land they have occupied for 10,000 years.
profile_positions.title: Chairman and CEO

profile_positions.description: Identifying uses for the revolutionary Lockheed Martin Hybrid Cargo Airship with major extraction projects (mining, petroleum, infrastructure, engineering, construction), humanitarian relief (Eradicating the Ebola crisis in West Africa), Arctic development and surveillance in Northern Canada and Europe, opening up the remaining resources in remote territories worldwide.
profile_positions.title: Chairman and CEO

profile_positions.location: Juba, Central Equatoria State, Republic of South Sudan
profile_positions.description:
Wrote and Implementing the Master Plan and signed the contract for the  construction of a new Commercial Capital in Juba, Republic of South Sudan. This will create the business, commercial capital of the country with a national hospital, university, sports stadium, and hotel center. 

Major infrastructure will be built including all roads, a Customs container dry port storage and distribution complex, a wet port on the Nile River for water transport inland, a new Juba International Airport, a new agro-industrial food processing zone to be self-sufficent and create exports, tax free special economic zone, 303,000 acres of surrounding agricultural development, roads to connect with the Port of Lamu and the LAPSSET Corridor connecting East and West Africa. 

The completion of Cecil Rhodes' dream includes the Cape Town to Cairo rail interconnect, petroleum pipelines, a new national refinery and telecoms connections to East Africa and throughout the Continent. The Concession is on 46,654 acres of land in Juba County on the White Nile River, a very unique Joint Venture involving the local people who own the land. A 50 year renewable lease which shares the profits of the enterprise with the local Barri and Lulubo communities guarantees that the local people will participate and receive direct benefits from the process. 

AIC is raising all private debt finance for the $25 billion project.
profile_positions.title: Chairman and CEO

profile_positions.description: As Chairman and CEO of Canada-Africa Mining Corporation, consultant to the Chairmen of Falconbridge, Sherritt, INCO, Vale, HudBay, AngloAmerican and numerous other world-class Canadian, UK, Swiss and American mining companies, developed numerous large-scale mining and Infrastructure projects in Canada, UK, USA, Middle East, Africa, Mexico and South America. Built owned and operated numerous base, precious, strategic and industrial minerals and mining projects throughout Africa as Chairman of America Mineral Fields, International Cobalt Corporation and others (Kolwezi Cobalt, Kilembe Copper, Kasese Cobalt, Minatura Gold, Kibi Goldfields, etc.)
profile_positions.title: Chairman

company.name: Global Fund Fighting AIDS, Malaria and TB

volunteer_experiences.description: Assisted in financing the discovery, flying samples of the proof by private aircraft from Africa to Europe and America, funding attempts to find cures, and set up prevention programs worldwide working with government Presidents, Ministers and Ministries of Health, the UN Secretary General and Head of the UN AIDS directorate (Dr. Peter Piot), the World Health Organization, The International Committee of the Red Cross, various national and local hospitals, university and corporate medical research agencies including the Centre for Disease Control (Atlanta, GA, USA), Institute for Tropical Diseases (Winnipeg, Canada) and hundreds of corporate donors.
